results.definition: marijuana leaves rolled into a cigarette for smoking
stick to firmly
be a devoted follower or supporter
stay put (in a certain place)
put, fix, force, or implant
examples: stick your thumb in the crack

results.definition: be a mystery or bewildering to
a lever used by a pilot to control the ailerons and elevators of an airplane
be loyal to
informal terms for the leg
examples: fever left him weak on his sticks

results.definition: saddle with something disagreeable or disadvantageous
come or be in close contact with; stick or hold together and resist separation
a long implement (usually made of wood) that is shaped so that hockey or polo players can hit a puck or ball
a long thin implement resembling a length of wood
an implement consisting of a length of wood
examples: he collected dry sticks for a campfire
the kid had a candied apple on a stick

results.definition: a rectangular quarter pound block of butter or margarine
a small thin branch of a tree
be or become fixed
examples: The door sticks--we will have to plane it

results.definition: cover and decorate with objects that pierce the surface
examples: stick some feathers in the turkey before you serve it

results.definition: endure
fasten into place by fixing an end or point into something
examples: stick the corner of the sheet under the mattress

results.definition: fasten with an adhesive material like glue
examples: stick the poster onto the wall

results.definition: fasten with or as with pins or nails
examples: stick the photo onto the corkboard

results.definition: pierce or penetrate or puncture with something pointed
pierce with a thrust using a pointed instrument
threat of a penalty
examples: the policy so far is all stick and no carrot
